awd_abstract_narration: The first year of this college and public school collaborative will             provide an intense four week summer institute and monthly academic year         follow-up for 90 junior and senior high school (7-12) mathematics               teachers of the Oakland Public Schools in California. The second year is        designed for 90 middle school (5-8) Oakland teachers.  At least sixty           percent of the teachers will be minorities. The plan is to assist the           teachers upgrade and deepen their mathematical knowledge, beyond the            materials of the new text book adoptions.  The content, for the first           year will range from pre-algebra to pre-calculus, with geometry a               requirement for all teachers.  In addition, effective teaching methods,         assessment materials, classroom procedures will be explored.                                                                                                    There is significant cost sharing by the Oakland Public Schools.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
